I absolutely love this show! No other cartoon I've seen has so much great humour! Although I have to agree with you lot, the Simpsons is getting more and more weird as the series progresses. Nevertheless, brilliant programming!

The Simpsons is a cartoon people of all ages can enjoy. But when it comes to the new episodes, you have to be a first-time watcher to enjoy it. If you have been watching the simpsons since at most '95, you will notice the newer episodes don't make you fall on the floor, laughing uncontrollably. The newer episodes have no plot.(and they admit it.) Remember the "first day of spring" episode?? That was one of the many terrible episodes. If you are 12 and do not agree with me, ask and older brother who has been watching for about 6 years or so.

In the beginning, there were The Simpsons, "crudely drawn" bumpers on The sadly overlooked Tracy Ullman Show.It's 2003 and we in beijing who are lucky enough to have Star TV out of hong kong (chinese nationals aren't allowed to have this show) are watching season 11 every sunday night and loving every minute of it as if it were 1989 once again. I'm 39 years old and life stops when the simpsons come on just like when i'm back home in the states. What's nice is that star runs "reruns" monday thru friday, so I get to catch up on season missed when i was in part of the world that didn't have it (or if they did have it, it was dubbed into the local language.  I ain't in to that at all.)I remember being very skeptical when plans were announced to take these 30 sec. ammusing "outro" to the commercials and turn them into a full-fledged sit-com.  I gave it 13 episode, if they were lucky and they'd be back on Tracy Ullman (were she to survive another season, which she barely did but only one, unfortunately.  I miss her.)Reading the comments here, i had no idea so many people hated the Simpsons. I really don't understand it, especially when they are comparing it to Friends, which was always ludicrous and never funny (the success of that show reminds me of the sucess of The Beverly Hillbillies #1 for many many years; Happy Days, Laverne and Shirley all #1 for years and years)and Seinfeld (my dad's favorite show), which lacks any character you can root for, therefore, never have i laughed once at that show.  In twenty years, I predict (I have been very wrong before) both Friends and Sienfeld will be totally forgotten or looked upon as "Why was that show so successful?" as we do today with Hillbillies, HDs and L&S.The Simpsons will live on forever.  Each carefully crafted episode, and there are over 300 at this writing, i think, is ageless, timeless, and will not date itself.  Ever.  The writing continues to provoke and more importantly, it is very consistant.  That is the key - consistancy.  Sure, you maybe able to find a bad episode from time to time, but by and large, the writing and the animation continue to be of the highest quality, not to mention the voice actors are perfectly cast.  i always see something new in episodes i've watched a half a dozen times. How many shows can you say that about?  Not too many i don't think.The Simpsons is fresh in much the same way that The Dick Van Dyke Show, The Honeymooners (foretting these two are B/W) and All in the Family are fresh and vibrant (albeit AITF an issue oriented "time capsule" show. I'll use certain episodes to teach in american lit. classes.) today as they were when they were new, maybe even more so now. I don't think time will be very kind to Friends (illegal DVDs are appearing here in china.  Sadly, the Chinese have caught the Friends bug too.  Again, i really don't get it.)  or Sienfeld, or even another personal favorite, Married With Children, i think it will look old in twenty years.  Maybe it already does.I realize why my members of my family hate The Simpsons.  They are LDS!! And they think it's trash. The Simpsons pokes fun at EVERYTHING including Christians and that's what makes it so alive.  Anybody can get lampooned. Maybe i'm more opened to a good gag because i live in a country where people wouldn't ever think of animating Chairman Mao or Zhang Zemin because they would simply "disappear".  (The Chinese communist party has no sense of humor)  So when i see the George Bush/Gerry Ford episode, (which is not one of the best) I have to say that The Simpsons is all-american and it represents what makes america such a great country... by poking fun at it's flaws, of which there are many and because we can. As Americans, we don't have to live within the  confines of the phony patriotism i am exposed to over here in the People's (that's a laugh) Republic (insanity) of China (no humor).  And after more than a decade, Matt Groeing and his gang or artists, and i mean everyone involved with show is an artist - the simpsons is a work of art - they do it better than anybody else.

i have read a lot of comments on this part of the website and a lot of people are saying that the simpsons has been running for too long.  this probably is true, but you have to say to yourself: What would life be like without the simpsons?  people relate to what happens in the simpsons and can learn from homers stupid mistakes.these comments i have read also changed my view on the simpsons.  i thought that everyone liked the simpsons. literally. but sadly, this is not the case.take friends for example, its been running for 10 series and i dont see it as a hilarious comedy sitcom. its like, "oooh, joey opened a door! hahahahahahaha." and after friends they are making a spinoff series called "joey"? my advise is no.there are dodgy episodes in the simpsons. every show has made slip ups and crap episodes. like the one where homer and ned go to las vegas.  that episode i didnt laugh once. however i will not comment on the recent episodes, because coming from the uk the bbc (british broadcasting corporation) are stupid and they show seasons 1-10 over and over again. so i dont know what to expectthe simpsons is my favourite show, its for everyone, it is consistently funny and people want more and more. so to you anti simpsons losers, they are still there whether you like it or not, and homer is not selfish, he has always put his family and friends first. no matter how fat, lazy and stupid he is. unlike a lot of families, they are hapilly together if marge isnt attractive, why did mr burns, lenny, carl, moe, kodos and kang and a lot of unfortunate people fancy the a*** off her? homer has also been voted the greatest american of all time. this means there are maniacs out there gagging for more of the simpsonsSO JOIN WITH ME AND KEEP CHEERING ON THE WORLDS GREATEST FAMILY AND TV SHOW!!!!!!!!!!

in response to the oft asked question, check the ratings. With the exception of sporting events, the simpsons is almost always the highest ranking program for Fox. I happen to like the show, but for those that don't, maybe this info will help you sleep better at nite, knowing that Fox is just trying to keep it's highest rated program on till it falls.

I think The Simpsons is still and awesome show, whether or not it's gotten kind of dumb over the last three years. I agree with other users that The Simpsons are just not what they used to be, and that they were the funniest from about '92-'99. For one thing, the animation is too detailed. One reason why past episodes were so funny is that the animation was still developing. I can't really put my finger on it, but for some reason that made it funnier. But I understand that the animation will keep changing as time goes on. Another problem is Homer Simpson cries too much. He starts throwing a tantrum over the stupidest things. Past episodes where funny because Homer was a big idiot. Not a big baby. And the plot lines were hilarious too. For example, when Lisa becomes a vegetarian. The flying pig gag is classic! Or when Homer and Grandpa make the love tonic."But I'm using my whole a**". That's the kind of play with words we want to see. Or when George Bush moves across the street. You get the idea. But now we have plots that are ridiculous. Like when Marge was a body builder, or when she got implants, but the worst was when Ned Flanders slept with that lady up on the hillside. The idea that he was so churchy made his character funny. I think that episode destroyed his character completely. Don't get me wrong though. I still watch The Simpsons every Sunday night in hopes that it will be a good episode and I think you all should too. And they're not all bad. The Simpsons hasn't completely lost its touch. There are still funny jokes here and there, and I think they should keep it on the air for as long as possible.

No-one can argue with me, the Simpsons was, is and shall always be the greatest thing to hit the airwaves EVER! Who can ever create another character better than Homer J Simpson? If you actually think about it, most animated shows or sitcoms that have followed The Simpsons have as their main character a fat, stupid, alcoholic, blundering, loveable idiot. Remind you of anyone?! Everyone knows that Homer rocks so they try their hardest to copy him. It never works. He's the origional and still the best. LONG LIVE THE SIMPSONS!!!!!!!!

The Simpsons is truly the best television series out there! Each episode is filled with laughter and fun. Every second of the Simpsons is worth watching. I've watched almost every episode out there and would defiantly recommend this to anyone who's alive.Each character has a complex life style and they are all funny in their own way. The beauty of this series is that no matter what episode you watch, you don't have to be common with the Simpsons to enjoy and be amused.There is a reason why the Simpsons are still running today after almost 20 years!

This is the greatest show ever. It's the only show in the world where a line like:"Yeah, but what are you gonna do" or "Slag off!" can make you laugh. Not even the great show Futurama. And the voice over-actors are just great, especially Dan Castellaneta. The only bad thing is that it's, according to me not as fun as it used to be in season 2-5 but still, it can't get any better than this!Congratulations to everybody at The Simpsons! Great job!

I've always been a big Simpsons fan, but watching the DVDs really made me realize how genius the show really is. Every episode has me laughing all the way through. The only other sitcom that was able to do that was Seinfeld. Shows like "Selmas Choice" (Marge, can I be alone with the sandwich for a moment?) and "Marge vs. the Monorail" (I call the big one Bitey!) are really the highlights of the series. Unfortunately, the last few seasons of this great show have been undeniably stale, relying on trendy guest stars and thin plot lines. I have hope, though, that this show will pull through. Even if it is to be cancelled, we still have the movie to hope for. If you are a Simpsons fan, or a fan of funny television in general, buy the Seasons 3 and 4 DVDs. You won't be disappointed.

I just would like to say that the Simpson's is the best show ever. It must never end. For the people who think it makes you "dumber" I am living proof that it doesn't. I am very successful in life and hey guess what, I watch Simpsons every week. So stop wasting your time telling everyone else why the show sucks. To all the fans like me stick together and watch the show all the time so that we will never have to see the frightful day when the world looses its humor. As I said before please people stop wasting our time with remarks against Simpsons. I love them and the world obviously does too, SO get over it. This investment is not a waste of a single penny.

After 16 years you would think they would get old, but they haven't.Season 5 is in the prime of this young series. The comedy writing is highly entertaining in this, and in all seasons. There are many classic Simpsons episodes in this season, I am very fond of "Lady Bouvier's Lover". I like when the story is on one of the lesser characters. I had wondered what had become of Marge's mom. Also, "Cape Feare" is a great example of how the writers have 'borrowed' from the movies. I especially love Sideshow Bob's performance in this episode. If you are already a Simpsons fan you will love it, and already own it. If you are new to the Simpsons let me guarantee that you will fall in love with the series if you can handle their subtle messages for world peace. All in all the Simpsons are amazing, and so is season 5!

Jellyneckr- Obviously, you don't know what you're talking about seeing as how the Simpsons is the longest running animated sitcom in TV history. Theview expressed in the show are intelligent and witty. Along with many political and religious undertones, there is also a sense of cultural criticism that this show likes to poke fun at and actually walks the line in doing so. Family Guy also has a great, somewhat intelligent, look at the mannerisms of our modern day culture. Maybe you'll give these shows another chance and try to see it from this point of view and realize that some of these types of shows actually have more realism than some people give them credit for, rather than thinking they are only "cartoons". These shows remind us that life doesn't always have to be looked at as so dire and serious, and to remember to laugh at life.The Simpsons is a part of our culture,that will never die.

Though I've only started watching the Simpsons show a couple years ago, I've watched all of the 300 something episodes. FUNNY, FUNNY, FUNNY. Why? Because it's realistic, yet totally fictional. They add all these little things that make it great. There are probably over a hundred characters that appear regularly, and many more that just have side jobs and background filler positions. All of them with different personalities, traits, and features.Nobody can explain this show. You just have to watch it yourself to find out.REAL GOOD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This show mostly follows the adventures and happenings of the Simpsons family. The father is Homer, an unbelievably incompetent drunkard who works at the local powerplant. The mother is Marge, the completely stressed housewife desperately trying to hold her family together. There son is Bart, the class clown. Lisa is the smart, sax playing, environmentalist daughter. Maggie is the shotgun wielding baby.Some episodes barely are about the family, instead featuring the over 100 recurring characters ranging from the ultra-religious Ned Flanders to the smart Sideshow Bob, who is dead set on killing Bart.I'm currently 12 and have been watching this show since I was 10. It has helped me become more aware of who people are with its references.The show is just plain hilarious. It is the only show that has the ability to start with the family sitting in the car on the way to the doctors, and end up with them immigrating back to America. You never are sure what is going to happen next in this hilarious show.

The Simpsons is great! The old and new episodes! It's funny, fun to watch, great animation, etc etc etc. I just flat out love everything about this awesome show! Most episodes of this show are O.K. for kids to watch, unless you worry about Homer's frequent alcohol consumption. Some episodes have little sexual content, so watch out. About the bad language, however, from what I can tell, my 12 year old son hears worse in middle school than this show this has lots of story left. someone please write something about him coming back or homer having to go to court for being involved with is company. i loved Hank, he was funny. There isn't too much violence or cussing, although Homer excessively drinks beer. Either way, a very well written show except for the latest episodes (2004-Present). I would prefer the older ones.

The Simpsons is a comic strip of a cartoon sitcom. It makes short jabs to get you to laugh but still holds a coherent story line while it's doing it. To appreciate the show you will need to start in a single digit season. The reason for this is because the show has been dead for many, many years. Season made after 2005 are hardly watchable and should never be supported/watched. They moved from character development and witty plot lines, like homer working for a James Bond villain for the sole reason he has great benefits, to a clich of itself. In summary watch the early seasons and avoid the latter seasons so we can stop those money grabbing basters from destroying one of the greatest shows of all time.

The Simpsons, I strongly believe, will be the ONLY animated TV show to ever run for more than 15 seasons and still have more laughs coming. From 1989 to now! I wouldn't be surprised if it was still going by the time I turn 21 and that's quite a while from now. This is the best comedic-animated show I've ever seen. I grew up watching this show and I can only hope that the show will still be on when I have kids. This is the one show that I can say that I can never get bored with. All of the people doing the voices are all at ages that they can do another 20 years worth of shows. This is one of the very few shows that hasn't gone completely computer animated and fired all of it's animators. This show draws audiences of all ages and I don't think anything could change that.

The Simpsons are without doubt the greatest comedy cartoon. I could easily say that most of the people reading this comment know Homer, Bart, Lisa, Marge and Maggie. The Simpsons have been on air for quite a while but still it dint lose the comedy "spirit". The series have made fun of almost everything (religion, politics, celebrities etc.). The only reason for not loving the Simpsons is that it somehow offends you. The series first appeared on FOX in 1989 and instantly became a great hit. In the first few series the plots were usually concentrated on the Simpson family members but later on extended to citizens of Springfield like Apu, Krusty the clown and Ned Flanders. The Simpsons featured several guests like Leonard Nimoy, Mel Gibson, Pierce Brosnan and much more. Each episode has a unique plot, great jokes, guest stars and as i mentioned before, the comedy "Spirit".

This is a great show. Funniness and even memes got through, but Lisa is the WCE! (WORST CHARACTER EVER!)Make a new character! One that's more silly and adventurous. Though. Good episodes make a good show.Spicing it up would be great. but I like it the way it is.
I watch it every day! And it's great still! The animation is great! The music is good! And the voice actors sound cool!
